utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, it's 0-Dark:30, in other words it's really, really early. Everyone's asleep, and all through the apartments not a creature was stirring, not even a mouse. That is except for the chick, who turns out to be a rooster and is crowing in the sun. Needless to say, this awakens Monica and Rachel who rush into their living room, searching for the cause of the sound.]

utterances.transcript: What the hell is that?!! What the hell is that? Is that you? Ohhhhhhh!

utterances.transcript: Boy, you are really not a morning person.
BACK OFF!!! Get up! Get up! Get up! God damn it! Get up, get up, get up, get up, get up!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (angrily) BACK OFF!!! (She starts banging on their door.) Get up! Get up! Get up! God damn it! Get up, get up, get up, get up, get up!!
(Chandler opens the door, finally.)

utterances.transcript: It's the chick! She's...going through some changes.
Well the vet seems to think that's she's becoming a rooster. We're getting a second opinion.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well the vet seems to think that's she's becoming a rooster. (The rooster crows.) We're getting a second opinion.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, it's later that morning, everybody has gotten up and Ross and Phoebe has joined them for breakfast. Rachel is returning from shopping.]

utterances.transcript: Hey, what are you doing shopping at eight in the morning?
Well, I've been up since six. Thanks to somebody's dumb-ass rooster.
You guys you really should get rid of those animals. They shouldn't be living in an apartment.
Yeah! Especially not with all of these knives and cookbooks around...
All right. I'm gonna go to the fertility doctor and um, see if I'm ready to have Frank and Alice's embryo transferred into my uterus.
Now, how will they know if you're ready?
Oh, they're just gonna umm, look to see if my endometria layer is thick.
Oh, I can uh, check that for ya.

utterances.transcript_with_note: Good-bye! Good luck! (She opens the door to reveal Monica and Joey.)

utterances.transcript: Good luck. And I'm still right!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Good luck. (to Monica) And I'm still right!

utterances.transcript: She's mad because I know today's her laundry day and that means she's wearing her old lady underpants.
I can check that for ya.
I just-I can't believe that you think that you and Chandler know me and Rachel better than we know you.
Well... we-we do. You can only eat Tic Tacks in even numbers.
And you... Ross, I believe, if you check Rachel's bag you will find a half-eaten box of cookies in there.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Rachel) And you... Ross, I believe, if you check Rachel's bag you will find a half-eaten box of cookies in there.
(He does so, and finds a half-eaten box of cookies.) You're good. (Tries a cookie.) These are not.

utterances.transcript: I'm so not impressed. Everybody snacks when they shop.
Oh yeah? Ross, how many items left in that bag?
Okay, ten bucks says that we can name every item in that bag.
How many guesses do you get?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Ross) Stop that now!
(Ross reveals a bag of apples.)
Yes. Yes. Yes. (They're perfect so far.)

utterances.transcript: No! There's no orange juice in there! We win!!
Okay, well, we won that one.

utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh-oh, oh, oh-oh! (Whispers something in Joey's ear.)

utterances.transcript: No-no, not for like another two weeks.

utterances.transcript_with_note: I got it! Scotch... tape. (They're right.)

utterances.transcript: How did you know she would buy scotch tape?
Well, we used there's up last night making scary faces.
All right! Ten buck! Fork it over! Cough it up! Pay the piper! Gimme it.
That does not mean you know us better, I-I want a rematch.
Yeah, and none of these stupid grocery questions, real personal questions.
Yeah! And the winner gets a hundred bucks.
No! All right, who-who makes up the questions?
Oh sure, "Ross will do it!" It's not like he has a job, or a child, or a life of his own.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The Doctor's office, Dr. Zane is examining Phoebe as Frank and Alice watch.]

utterances.transcript: It looks like your uterus is ready for implantation.
Oh! I knew it! I knew it! I felt really thick this morning.
Well, okay, so what's now-go get, go get the eggs, put 'em in there.
Okay, it'll take just a little while to prepare the embryos.
Five? Okay, where am I giving birth, a hospital or a big box under the stairs?
We do five because that gives you a 25% chance that at least one will attach.
That's it! 25 percent? That means that's it's like 75 percent chance of no baby at all!
Hey, y'know I was thinking, what are the odds like if-if, if you stuff like 200 of them in there?
Sweety, now, she's a woman, not a gumball machine.
Okay, well y'know what, don't worry you guys, 'cause I'm-I'm gonna do this as many times as it takes to get it right.
Well, you see, the-the thing is, we-we only got, we kinda have one shot to make it right.
Umm, it costs $16,000 each time you do this. So, umm, we're kinda using all the money we have to do it just this one time.
Whoa!! That-okay, that's a lot of pressure on me and my uterus. So, well okay, so is there-is maybe is there something that I can do y'know just to like help make sure I get pregnant?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Whoa!! That-okay, that's a lot of pressure on me and my uterus. (to Dr. Zane) So, well okay, so is there-is maybe is there something that I can do y'know just to like help make sure I get pregnant?

utterances.transcript: Wow! You guys really don't know anything!
I know! Why don't you get drunk! That worked for a lot of girls in my high school.

utterances.transcript: You guys! Do you realize that any minute now, Phoebe can be pregnant?
I know! I know, it's such a huge, life-altering thing.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They all pause and think about it.)
Yeah! Yes! (They all right into the living room, all excited.)

utterances.transcript: Okay, each team will answer ten questions. The first team that answers the most questions wins. Okay, the categories are, Fears and Pet Peeves, Ancient History, Literature, and It's All Relative. Now, the coin toss to see who goes first. Okay, somebody call it this time.

utterances.transcript: It's heads. Gentlemen, pick your category.
utterances.transcript_with_note: It's heads. (The guys celebrate.) Gentlemen, pick your category.

You guys are dead, I am so good at lighting rounds.
I majored in lightning rounds. All right, we're gonna destroy you.

utterances.transcript: Hey-ooh Pheebs, are they in there?

I don't care, I'm not going anywhere.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Phoebe comes in from the bathroom as Rachel sits down in disgust.)

utterances.transcript: It's only been a couple of hours, so just give it some time.

utterances.transcript_with_note: No! Put that box down! We are not going anywhere! This is my apartment and I like it! This is a girl's apartment! That is a boy's apartment, it's dirty and it smells.
